intro: Oxytropis merkensis, commonly known as Merk's locoweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in nutrient-poor soils. Oxytropis merkensis is also known for its toxic alkaloids, which can be harmful to livestock.
